applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document, not an insurance quotation. While it describes an insurance-based product, it is specifically the scheme rules that govern how the pension life cover works. 2) The regulation specifically pertains to information that must be included in insurance quotations provided to consumers. This document is a comprehensive scheme rules document that outlines the operation, benefits, and administration of a company pension life cover scheme, not a quotation document. 3) The document appears to be business-to-business in nature (between an employer and AIB life) rather than a consumer-facing quotation document. The scheme is established by an employer for their employees, making it an occupational pension scheme rather than a direct-to-consumer insurance product. 4) While the document does contain various terms and conditions, these are not warranties or endorsements that would need to be highlighted in a quotation as per the regulation.
regulation_title: Information to be provided in insurance quotation - warranties and endorsements
regulation_text: 329. (1) An insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall set out clearly any warranties or endorsements that apply to an insurance policy in an insurance quotation provided to a consumer. (2) If the insurance quotation is provided on paper or on another durable medium, the information referred to in paragraph (1) shall not be in a smaller font size than is used for other information appearing in the document.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
